IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: Suffield Academy is a coeducational independent secondary school serving a diverse student body of day and boarding students from across the United States and from many foreign counties. The school is grounded in a tradition of academic excellence combined with a strong work ethic; respect for individual differences and a commitment to scholarship guide our curriculum and pedagogy. We engender among our students a sense of responsibility and challenge them to grow in a school community that is both structured and nurturing. We expect our students to emerge from their Suffield experience for a lifetime of learning and active citizenship.
IRS990.MissionDesc: Suffield Academy is a coeducational independent secondary school serving a diverse student body of day and boarding students from across the United States and from many foreign counties. The school is grounded in a tradition of academic excellence combined with a strong work ethic; respect for individual differences and a commitment to scholarship guide our curriculum and pedagogy. We engender among our students a sense of responsibility and challenge them to grow in a school community that is both structured and nurturing. We expect our students to emerge from their Suffield experience for a lifetime of learning and active citizenship.
IRS990.Desc: Educational Delivery, General/Other: The school provides non-discriminatory education to approximately 400 students, grades 9-12. This education is academic, athletic and social.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The school occasionally receives works of art to be used in the general decor of the school and as a teaching tool. There were no such donations in the current year. These transactions are minor and therefore Audit Financial Statement Disclosure was waived.
Various pieces of visual arts, mostly paintings donated for display in the academic buildings.
Endowment funds have been established for a variety of purposes including Scholarship, Prize and Awards, Support Services and General Support of the school.

The Academy accounts for uncertain income tax provisions included in Accounting Standards Codification ("ASC") 740. ASC740 prescribes detailed guidance for financial statement recognition, measurement and disclosure of uncertain tax positions recognized in an enterprise's financial statements. Tax positions must meet a more-likely-than-not recognition threshold to be recognized, and the Academy monitors its potential tax positions throughout the year.The Academy believes there are no uncertain income tax positions at June 30, 2016.
Capital gifts are recorded below the operating revenue line in the audited financial statements and certain expenses most notably financial aid are netted against revenue in the financial statements.
Certain expenses are netted against revenue in the audited financial statements most notably financial aid.
The school provides its non discrimination policy in all publications and on its website.

GrantsOtherAsstToIndivInUSGrp.NonCashAssistanceDesc: Provided as a credit against students tuition statement.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Grants issued are only for tuition and board provided by the school based upon demonstrated need and merit.

The school is a residential program, housing is provided to faculty (which the Headmaster, Assistant Treasurer, Director of Development, Dean of Faculty, Dean of Academic Affairs and Director of College Counseling are) as a condition of employment for the needs and convenience of the school. An estimaed value of housing is included in column D.

The board of trustees hired a compensation consultant when establishing the Headmasters' contract to perform a study of compensation at peer institutions. The committee utilized this data in establishing a contract. Annually peer compensation data is updated and reviewed by the full board when establishing the pay of the Headmaster. The full board votes on the Headmasters' annual pay. The Headmaster, an executive trustee, does not vote or participate in these discussions. The Assistant Treasurers' compensation is set by the Headmaster and reviewed annually with the board of trustees with comparisons to similar organizations.

The Headmaster received a 457F payment after completing a five year contractual period in which he committed to remain at the school. A prorated accrual for this payment was also reported in previous filings as required by the Internal Revenue Code.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 11b
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The schools 990 was distributed, reviewed and discussed by the full board at its May 2017 meeting.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 12c
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: All trustees, senior administrators and employees who oversee the significant budget are required annually to review the schools conflict of interest statement and submit a statement to the school both affirming independence and if necessary disclosing conflicts. All trustees and employees are to bring conflict of interest to the President or the Head of the School if and when they occur.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The school board hired an independent consultant to provide peer review and data on compensation for the Headmaster when his contract was established. Annually, the Headmasters position relative to peers is updated. The full board reviews the data and votes on the Headmasters compensation. In addition the compensation is reviewed with the full board with comparisons to peer data.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, Line 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Audited financial statements are posted to EMMA.MSRB.ORG, all other documents are available upon request.
Rounding
No changes to the process from the prior year.
